title: fa.functional analysis - Eigenvalues of product of operators
body: Let $A,B$ be two Trace class operators with spectral decomposition $\sum_{j\geq 1} \lambda_j \phi_j(\cdot)\otimes \phi_j(\cdot)$ and $\sum_{j\geq 1} \gamma_j \psi_j(\cdot)\otimes \psi_j(\cdot)$ respectively. Can one say anything about the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of $A^{1/2}BA^{1/2}$ maybe under further assumptions ? In particular I am curious if clean relationships exist between the eigenvalues of $A^{1/2}BA^{1/2}$ and $\lambda_j$ , $\gamma_j$ , for $j\geq 1$ in some special cases ? fa.functional-analysis operator-theory eigenvalues Share Cite Improve this question Follow asked Aug 4, 2020 at 6:17 Kcafe 509 3 3 silver badges 13 13 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 3 1 $\begingroup$ the eigenvalues of $A^{1/2}BA^{1/2}$ are the same those of $AB$. $\endgroup$ Carlo Beenakker –  Carlo Beenakker 2020-08-04 06:25:45 +00:00 Commented Aug 4, 2020 at 6:25 $\begingroup$ Are you assuming $A$ is a positive trace class operator? Otherwise $A^{1/2}$ doesn't make sense to me.. $\endgroup$ Darth Vader –  Darth Vader 2020-08-04 23:46:10 +00:00 Commented Aug 4, 2020 at 23:46 $\begingroup$ @Darth Vader Yes indeed $\endgroup$ Kcafe –  Kcafe 2020-08-05 01:47:42 +00:00 Commented Aug 5, 2020 at 1:47 Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
